node.rich_text: - nginx 1.18.0 - keeper.htb → Link - tickets.keeper.htb → Request Tracker 4.4.4+dfsg-2ubuntu1 (exploits): ⇒ Opensource:
Lise NĂ¸rgaard - has a dump in her home directory - root Enoch Root - Password was stored in search -> Users -> lnorgaard -> Welcome2023!

there was a keepass dump, protected by password: - Try cracking the keepass hash with john: keepass2john - Exploit research on Keypass: Master Password Dumper → Get the result and google search to discover the missing char - There was in a comment the PUTTY ssh file (ssh key for Windows) which can be converted in Linux ssh

Apache httpd 2.4.52 Flask 3.0.3
- titanic.htb → json file generated while booking → File inclusion - dev.titanic.htb GitTea → developer@titanic.htb → docker-config ⇒ mysql 8.0
with tickets database ⇒ Password: MySQLP@$$w0rd! → flask-app ⇒ Run on port

⇒ /tickets is where tickets are stored
File inclusion on config files of: - ssh - flask-app - gitea → The folder is known:

⇒ gitea.db ⇒ app.ini - docker
After getting the hash from gitea.db -> google how to crack gitea hashes->25282528
In /opt there is a file that gets executed by root and calls /usr/bin/magick with a jpg Check version of magick and exploit research with jpg input
